title: Cryptoababe
author: Cryptoababe
content: I was scrolling around on my Telegram with dark mode. So, I saw a link that directed me to Bitcointalk. After opening it, I had to close it back immediately and come back later because everything was too bright for me emdure. Is there a way to add dark mode to the forum? If there is, I think it will be a very good idea.

comments.author: LeGaulois
comments.body: No, there is no option for that and it's something that has been asked a lot of timeHowever, here is Bitcointalk with a dark modeIt works with any browser based on Chromium (Brave, Chrome, Opera, Edge, Vivaldi, Epic...)Open in a new tab chrome://flags/#enable-force-dark and select "Enable"Otherwise, https://chrome.google.com/webstore/search/dark%20mode?hl=en

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: You are going to need an add-on or extension. I use dark reader at the moment and good thing about it is you can adjust to any shade of darkness you want.I think i have seen a few users suggest scripts here and there.

comments.author: AverageGlabella
comments.body: Just go to the addons page of your browser and install a dark mode. Beware some of them might be dangerous and you should only download it if you really need this and you trust the author of the addon. I recommend open source addons if you can find them. It sounds like you will be looking for a phone based browser addon and I think only certain addons are supported on mobile devices. You could inject custom css if you can code css but there is no official dark mode for the forum you would need to get a custom solution just for the forum but you can get universal addons like I said.

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptoababe on February 16, 2023, 11:02:15 PMI was scrolling around on my Telegram with dark mode.Just to let you know, telegram got a dark mode and a night mode. Try night mode, it is better than the first one.Quote from: Cryptoababe on February 16, 2023, 11:02:15 PMIs there a way to add dark mode to the forum?Since many users already suggested you the ways, I'd prefer you to use the mode suggested by @Bitcoin_Arena, it looks perfectly black (best for night usage too), while @LeGaulois's suggested mode gives you a bit dark grayish background screen if you observe it carefully.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptoababe on February 16, 2023, 11:02:15 PMIs there a way to add dark mode to the forum?There are plenty of ways. One of them is to install the BPIP extension to your browser (Chrome/Chromium based or Firefox) and, amongst a lot of other nice features, you can enable one of the dark themes from there.The BPIP extension topic is: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5224821.0and you can find it (for free) in the browser's add-ons/extensions "store". The links are also in the topic I've linked.

comments.author: Cryptoababe
comments.body: Thanks for all your response. They are very useful. Seems the dark mode only work on Desktops only. Quote from: LeGaulois on February 16, 2023, 11:14:09 PMIt works with any browser based on Chromium (Brave, Chrome, Opera, Edge, Vivaldi, Epic...)Open in a new tab chrome://flags/#enable-force-dark and select "Enable"But it looks like this one I quoted should be able to work with mobile devices.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptoababe on February 17, 2023, 12:07:04 PMThanks for all your response. They are very useful. Seems the dark mode only work on Desktops only. I don't know if you are a fan of Firefox browser for Android, but in case you are, the add-on (dark reader) is also available for the mobile browser. It's available on iOS as well. However, is not available on chrome from Android.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: I also had a desire to change theme on the forum to the night mode for a long time. I thank OP for creating this topic and members who answered, thanks to which I learned how to do it. The solution is simple, in fact, and if desired, it could be easily googled. I'm interested in the next point. Can't these extensions somehow get account details like username and password? How safe is it to use it?I understand that this is somewhat deviating from the original topic under discussion, but I believe that all the same, within the framework of the dark mode on Bitcointalk.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: m2017 on February 17, 2023, 02:48:54 PMI'm interested in the next point. Can't these extensions somehow get account details like username and password? How safe is it to use it?If the extension is designed for malicious purposes then yes, they will be able to get your detailsFor Dark reader, It's open source, and its development started around 2014. You can view and verify the code Code:https://github.com/darkreader/darkreaderYou can also view and modify the permissions of the add-on or extension manager;For exampleBpip add-onDark reader add-on

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptoababe on February 16, 2023, 11:02:15 PMIs there a way to add dark mode to the forum? There is no dark theme switch, but you can install custom themes or use extensions and add-ons with dark themes, BPIP would be nice option that enable many other useful stuff for bitcointalk.I don't know what web browser you use, but for Chrome or Brave browser you can do one small trick to enable dark theme for all websites, and all that without installing any script or extension.You can do this by entering this text in your browser address bar: chrome://flags/#enable-force-darkYou can Enable any option you like most, restart your browser and you can always return back to Default option.
